description: Construction of a two storey building with accommodation in the roof space to provide 8 self-contained flats including associated amenity space, car parking, refuse storage and cycle storage provision (following demolition of two semi-detached dwellings)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Location Plan ref. 19/5824/LP; Block Plan ref. 19/5824/BP; Existing Plans and Street Elevations ref. 19/5824/04; Proposed Plans ref. 19/5824/01 rev B; Proposed Elevations ref. 19/5824/02 rev A; Street Scene Elevations ref. 19/5824/03 rev B.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).
| The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 40 mg/kWh shall be completed prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to first occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first occupation and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| No development (including initial site clearance) shall commence until a Demolition and Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The management plan must refer to the following matters:
a.	Removal of any earth from the site.
b.	Construction methods.
c.	Site management and access.
d.	Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site.
e.	Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on Karoline Gardens and surrounding areas.
f.	Vehicle and machinery specification.
g.	Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h.	Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i.	Parking of construction vehicles.
j.	Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l.	Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m.	Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The cycle parking facilities for a minimum of ten cycle spaces hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first use of any part of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The cycle parking shall be provided and located in a secure undercover and lockable compound.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The vehicle parking arrangements shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans details of hard and soft landscaping works, tree removal, tree planting including along the eastern boundary and a phased programme of works shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Hard and soft landscaping works, tree removal and tree planting including along the eastern boundary shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, or in accordance with the programme of works agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To secure protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which is of amenity value to the area and to ensure that the development is landscaped in the visual and ecological interests of the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.5 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
